column4: i've 3 partitions now, xp/vista/data all ntfs. if i install ubuntu... how do i go abt partitioning so unbutu gets space from ONLY data partition and not vista/xp partitions??

are you booted up into the CD now?
/home holds all your personal stuff, documents, music, settings, etc
remove all the kde packages - sudo aptitude purge $(dpkg -l | grep -i kde | cut -c 3-30)
: i entered that command and it says end kde session then hangs there saying "loading boot scripts" etc
sorry had a little to do, you entered the command right?
sudo aptitude purge $(dpkg -l | grep -i kde | cut -c 3-30)
